Text: You've been asked by a girl called Questelle in Angel Falls to go and find a
Erinn and Patty have left for Stornway, and Stella's joined your side
Try investigating the big spider's web on the other side of the river just outside the village. Keep your eyes peeled for something twinkly…

You found a tangleweb for Questelle in Angel Falls, and she gave you a sleeping hibiscus in return. She told you to look out for twinkly spots, as they show there's an item in that location. You can do this quest as many times as you like.
My name's Questelle. Have you heard of quests?
Then let me tell you all about them!
A quest is a favour that you do for someone in need of help.
You don't have to do it the moment they ask you, though.
No, you can just fit it in when the time is right. You don't have to lose sight of your own plans at all.
People with quests to give you have blue speech bubbles above their heads.
I, er, don't suppose I could ask you to do a quest for me now, could I? I really want a
But I'm desperate! I really want one.
Thank goodness! I was hoping you'd say yes.
You can find tanglewebs on the ground near big spider webs.
There's a really big one just to the east of the village, but you have to go the long way round by the river to get to it.
If there's a tangleweb there, you should see a twinkling spot on the ground. Look closer and you'll soon see if it's what you're after.
If someone's beaten you to it, the twinkling spot will disappear for a while, but it'll be back before long, so just be patient.
I'll be waiting here. Just one tangleweb, that's all I need!
So how did it go? Did you find me a tangleweb?
Wow! It's a tangleweb! An actual tangleweb! No way!
Thank you so much, well, one good turn deserves another, as they say. Here, take this!
Twinkly spots disappear when an item's picked up, but they start to sparkle again a while later, so it's worth checking back.
Anyway, good luck on your travels. Try to help as many people out along the way as you can, won't you?
Returning to do the quest over again:
What I really want, more than anything in the world, is a tangleweb.
Can you help me? Please! Just one will do. A tangleweb would be the answer to my prayers.
I'll be waiting here. Just one tangleweb, that's all I need. You'll get it for me, won't you?
A girl in the church in Stornway wants you to egg her on with an air punch.

After you egged on Ricki in Stornway with an air punch, she taught you the 'Pirouette' party trick. You can assign your party tricks from the Misc. menu, and perform them by holding down the B Button and using the +Control Pad.
Och, just look at me! I've come all the way to church, but I just can't seem to get fired up enough to have a really good pray!
I don't suppose you could spur me on with a nice air punch, could you?
Oh. That's a shame. I was going to teach you all about how to use party tricks and everything.
Brilliant. My name's Ricky, by the way.
So, are you ready to show me a prime air punch?
If you go to 'Assign Party Tricks' in the Misc. menu, you can assign party tricks to each of the directions on the +Control Pad.
Assign the air punch to a direction, and then press the +Control Pad in that direction while holding down the B Button.
Once you've performed an air punch:
Aye, that's the stuff! That's the kind of air punch that could really get a person fired up for a good old pray!
Thanks ever so much. Och, but how can I repay you…? Oh, I know. Here, I'll teach you a jazzy new move…
Grus learns a new party trick. Now he can pirouette!
Ach, but it's no good. I'm still not quite fired up enough to get down on my knees and give the old prayin' a really good go…
You can assign party tricks from the Misc. menu. To use one, hold down the B Button and press a direction on the +Control Pad.
I'm still not quite fired up enough for a really good pray. You couldn't come back and egg me on again sometime, could you?
Ricki in the church in Stornway has asked you to egg her on with another party trick.
completed (and you've left and come back to the church)
Give Ricki in Stornway what she wants: four party tricks in a row! A pirouette, a clap, a jump and an air punch should do the trick!

You gave Ricki just what she wanted: four party tricks in a row. In return, she taught you the 'Pray' party trick. Don't forget: you can assign four party tricks to the down direction of the +Control Pad and unleash them all at once!
Like I said before, I'm still not quite fired up enough for a really good pray yet.
D'you fancy showing me some more of your best party tricks to help me along?
Och, that's a pity. I was going to tell you more about party tricks and everything.
Right then. This time, I want you to do a pirouette, a clap, a jump and then an air punch! Think you can manage that?
You can assign up to four party tricks to the down direction of the +Control Pad.
That way, you can perform all four in one go!
Give it a try! A pirouette, a clap, a jump and then an air punch! You can do it!
Oh aye, that's the stuff! Pumps the heart full of passion, so it does! I'm primed for a proper prayer session now!
Let's see now, how can I say thanks…? Oh aye, this should do nicely. Just do as I do…
Grus learns a new party trick. Now he can pray! (CLEAR!!)
Party tricks can make adventures with your friends all the more fun.
And there will be times on your journey when a party trick or two will come in handy too.
Assign them in the Misc. menu, and when you want to use one, just hold down the B Button. It's that simple!

According to the back of a sign you saw just outside Gleeba, a Gleeban beauty who runs a group called the Desert Foxes is looking for ten duneberries that parched peckerels tend to drop.
Fight with the parched pekerels around Gleeba. You cannot steal the duneberries, they must drop them and there's a chance that they won't.
You can check how many you have in your Important Items inventory.
Once you have 10, enter Gleeba and go to the dance hall.
In the dressing room, talk to the woman at the last mirror. She will ask you to give her the duneberries. Give them to her.

Ruki, a trainee guard from Gleeba, told you about a strange request he'd received. Apparently, the gold golems who roam the Djust Desert want someone to go after the fake gold-plated golem in their midst.
Exit Gleeba to the Djust Desert and travel down to the large canyon where the gold golems spawn.
Fight gold golems until you get an event at the end of a battle.

found in The Plumbed Depths drop it most frequently (1/8)
A young man who hangs around in the dance hall in Gleeba wants you to bring him three hocus chimaera feathers so he can impress Belinda, a girl who struts her stuff there.
Travel to the Heights of Loneliness and battle hocus chimaeras until one drops a hocus chimaera feather. You cannot steal these, they must drop them at the end of battle.
Do this until you have 3. You can check how many you possess in your Important Items inventory.
A peddler called Peregrine in Gleeba has asked you to fetch some
. You can get hold of some by defeating an expload with a critical attack.
Fight exploads in the large canyon in the Djust Desert, then use
to get a guaranteed critical kill, or just get lucky with a random crit.

A worried woman in the village shop in Angel Falls wants you to earn the 'Herbalist' accolade and hopefully set her mind at rest.
The accolade is earned by using 100 herb items.
The easiest and safest way to do this is by heading to Upover and walking over pools of lava. This will drain each party member's health moderately quickly without killing them.
Once your health is low, use as many
as you can until everyone is back to full health.
Repeat this until you have used 100 medicinal herbs.
You will gain the accolade when you check the battle records menu. You may have to close and reopen it if Stella doesn't give it to you the first time.
Go to the Misc. menu, then to Profile Settings. Change your Title to "Herbalist" under the Accolades menu.

Rufus from Stornway needs you to retrieve a woman's final letter and deliver it to a boy named Bryson in a place called Porth something. Defeat a
in a grotto with lots of water, and you may well find the letter.
Bling Badgers appear in high level water grottoes (rank 10-11).
Once you have access to them, keep killing them until the letter drops.
Speak to Bryson in Port Llaffan to finish the quest, you do not need to return to Rufus.

A man in Porth Llaffan wants you to help wake Mayor Bryce from the deep sleep he fell into following a shock. Unfortunately, he has no idea what will rouse him.
This quest has the same solution to quest 6.

Woody Nickitt, who lives on a small island east of Stornway, wants you to retrieve the memento of his lost love, Annabella, that he says was stolen by a man named Nicholas.

has the necklace, which can be found around Bloomingdale.
Kill pink sanguinis until the necklace drops, then report back to Woody.

Atlas appears as the boss in mid to high level grottoes.
He has around 6500HP, so deal a total of 5800 damage to him to get his health low enough.
Once his health is low, start using
until you successfully steal the tincture.
If the stolen item isn't the tincture, then Atlas' health wasn't low enough, and you will have to refight him to try again.
Shanice, the bunny girl in the northern well at the top of the mountain in Eastern Wormwood, wants you to bring her some shoes that will help her run as fast as a metal slime.
The shoes she is referring to are
They have a 1% chance of being found in rank A grotto chests.

Simply defeat him to get the Hexite, then give it to Cephalgernon.
A scrap of paper you found on a corpse in a cave on an island off the Cringle Coast implores you to locate a sea captain who set off across the sea in search of a certain grotto. Some

Marco, who teaches swordsmanship at Swinedimples, wants to put you to the test. He's asked you to find a red signpost that's somewhere out in the world, then come back and tell him what's written on it.
has been defeated, sword skill is at least 30
The sign in question is on an island north of Western Wormwood.
Take your ship and travel along the river between Wormwood and Stornway until you reach the island.
Once you've disembarked, read both the front
the back of the red sign.
Marco, who teaches swordmanship at Swinedimples, wants to put you to the test. On his travels he buried badges by the cities he visited, retrieve them all.
has been completed, sword skill is at 100
Go to the teacher's lounge in Swinedimples (leftmost room of the main buliding's entrance) and read the two bookshelves.
The books will tell you that there is a badge for the five following cities:
Kill any enemies in the specified areas until they drop that area's badge. The badges must be collected in the right order to drop.
Report back to Marco once you've got all five.

The metal medley has to die from the instant death hit of Pressure pointer. Killing it with regular damage, including regular damage from a whiffed Pressure Pointer, won't count towards beating the quest.
Lance, the spear teacher from Swinedimples, says that he'll teach you the ultimate spear ability if you pass his test. Use
in one go. Do this five times, and you've passed!
has been completed, spear skill is at 100
Head to The Gittish Empire and get into fights with Gloomy gastropogs.
Fighting individual Gloomy gastropogs is pointless, make sure you're fighting at least two of them per battle.
Gloomy gastropogs have 144HP, so depending on the spear-wielder's strength you might want to cast
on them, or whittle down the Gloomy gastropogs health to a lower margin.
Kill them both with Multithrust five times, then return to Lance.

who lives somewhere in the vicinity of the academy.

Get into fights with Shivery shrubberies.
The attack itself has to kill the shivery shrubbery, if the venom from toxic dagger kills them then it won't count.

has been completed, knife skill is at 100

on bad karmours until they are envenomated, then use Victimiser to kill them.
Do this for 10 of them, then talk to Madame Couteau.
There's an old man at Swinedimples Academy who needs his back scratching, but first you'll need to find the perfect wand for the job.
has been defeated, wand skill is at least 30
Travel to Slurry Quay and speak to the man in purple at the item shop.
Travel to Tywll Cave and defeat salamauraders until you receive a backscratcher.
Return to Swinedimples Academy and give Itchy the backscratcher.
Itchy, the wand teacher at Swinedimples, has hurt his back while trying to show you his greatest secret. He needs you to get a special remedy from Fanny and bring it to him as soon as you can.
has been completed, wand skill is at 100
Speak to Fanny on the right side of Swinedimples' second floor. She will tell you to get some
during this quest, found in The Magmaroo.
Toad oil can be dropped by various monsters, such as
Once you have both, talk to Itchy.
Paulo from Swinedimples wants you to use the
in the sea to the north of Gleeba, and bring back the mirror it stole from him.
has been defeated, staff skill is at least 30
Take the boat and sail back and forth along the ocean between the Djust desert and Urdus Marshland.
Keep doing this until a battle starts with a Stenchurion, then kill it with Deliverance.
Report back to Paulo to finish the quest.
Paulo's dear, departed darling Joy wants you to find a supreme scripture on the secrets of the staff and give it to Swinedimples' long-suffering staff teacher to cheer him up.
has been completed, staff skill is at 100
This quest can only be accepted at night.
as the boss, it appears in low level grottoes.
Equip the Laundry pole to any party member, then begin the fight.
Nemean has around 2800HP, get its health low, then keep using regular attacks from the person wielding the Laundry pole until it is defeated.
or increasing the tension of the staff wielder can help speed this up.

, give it to Paulo to end the quest.
Toadie, a pupil at Swinedimples, wants to buy his teacher Mr Whippy a new whip. See if you can find one he will be happy with.
has been defeated, whip skill is at least 30
Go to the small island west of Bloomingdale and speak to Catwright, the bunny girl just outside the lighthouse.
She will ask you to get her a
Kill power hammers until it drops.

Windy at Alltrades Abbey says you must use the Fource of Mother Nature if you want to join the great fellowship of the armamentalists. He wants you to erect a Wizard Ward before defeating two metal slimes in battle.
- Change all party members to mages and defeat metal slimes in the Quarantomb until they have all learned Wizard Ward. Return them to their previous classes.

- Travel back to the Quarantomb and wait behind the line at the entrance before you get to the stone monument until a metal slime appears. If you wait behind the line without moving, the enemies won't notice your presence.

- Wait to initiate battle when the slime has its back towards you. It will either switch positions around the monument or run off to the right or left. If it switches positions, wait until it switches back. If it runs off to the right or left, give chase. It seems more likely to flee if you surprise it before entering battle.
- If the slime is with another enemy, save your MP and don't bother with the Wizard Ward. It seems more likely to flee when with other enemies.
- If the slime is alone, have all party members use Wizard Ward, then attack the metal slime until defeated. Metal slash and any ability that lets you hit multiple times are helpful to use.
- Repeat until two metal slimes are defeated.

Sellma has asked you to borrow the Quester's Rest guestbook for her.

At the Quester's Rest in Stornway, speak to Sellma, the girl in green, behind the counter. She'll ask you if you can obtain the inn's guestbook from Erinn, who tells you to speak to Ginny in the southeast corner of the inn by the safe boxes.

Ginny will give you the guestbook when you speak with her, which you can give to Sellma afterwards. A scene will then occur where two thugs show up at the inn who want to see Sellma outside. Erinn will then ask you to go outside and check on her.

The two thugs will take the guestbook from her. Sellma will then ask you to get the book back from the thugs' underground base, which is located in the Plumbed Depths in Gleeba. The entrance is located at the bottom of the well inside the Mirage Mahal on L1.

Climb down the stairs in the dungeon to encounter the pair of thugs, who will run off. Go past the door locked with the Magic Key to find a set of stairs in the dungeon's graveyard area. There will then be a scene with the two thugs and their boss Al Capinne, along with Sellma. Al Capinne will then summon his pet Rover to attack the party.

Rover is not a difficult monster to fight. He has about 5,000 HP, acts twice per turn, and can attack with an earthquake attack and ice breath. It is recommended to protect the party with Kabuff and Insulatle.
After the battle, Evac from the dungeon and return to the inn at Stornway. Speak to Sellma behind the counter to complete the quest.

s. Octagoons can be found in rank 7-9 ruins grottoes or rank 10 cave grottoes. If you have entered the right type of grotto, there will be a scene with Erinn.

At the Quester's Rest in Stornway, speak to Pavo, the female Celestrian, behind the counter. The quest can only be initiated after completing quest #157. The prayer pearl can be obtained by defeating Excalipurr, a boss who appears in high-level grottoes. There are different tools online to see whether a treasure map will have Excalipurr as a boss.

Excalipurr has 6,600 HP, acts twice per turn, and uses various techniques such as Multislash, Hatchet Man, and Feel the Burn. He is weak to ice-elemental attacks. Protect the party with Kabuff and keep everyone's HP over 450. He will drop the prayer pearl after being defeated.

Return to Stornway and show the prayer pearl to Pavo at the inn. She will then ask you to deliver the pearl to Celestria in the Realm of the Almighty. After viewing the scene, leave the Realm and Zoom to Angel Falls to visit the guardian statue.
Speak to Aquila there and he will join the party.
Return to the Quester's Rest in Stornway and speak to Pavo again to complete the quest.
